Yagiz Erkan wrote:
>  > I'm surprised.
> 
> J.B.
> 
> AFAIK, there isn't any JUnit extension that can test a complex Web UI
> that uses JavaScript extensively. HttpUnit is using Rhino, which
> easily breaks when used against the imagination/expertise of our
> brilliant creative team. :-)
> 
> I think JWebUnit will soon be able to satisfy this type of
> requirements as Nick Neuberger is currently working on a version that
> uses IE components. This will at least help us to test complex
> Javascript on Windows platform.

HtmlUnit does some good Javascript stuff, but it might fall into the 
same category as HttpUnit. I know Mike Bowler doesn't actively add 
Javascript-related features to HtmlUnit; instead, he avoids Javascript.
-- 
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
